metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2295 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Versions of Puppet prior to 4.10.1 will deserialize data off the wire (from the agent to the server, in this case) with a attacker-specified format. This could be used to force YAML deserialization in an unsafe manner, which would lead to remote code execution. This change constrains the format of data on the wire to PSON or safely decoded YAML.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2295` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

puppet - 4.8.2-5ubuntu1
puppet-common - 4.8.2-5ubuntu1
puppet-master - 4.8.2-5ubuntu1
puppet-master-passenger - 4.8.2-5ubuntu1
puppetmaster - 4.8.2-5ubuntu1
puppetmaster-passenger - 4.8.2-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: puppet package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.2-5ubuntu1').
